After buying the toys, he went back to see that there are twice as many more dogs than when he left so he had to buy some more toys. When James came back yet again, 3 dogs were gone so he no longer needed those toys. How many toys in total does James need?

1.subquestion: Before going out shopping, what is the number of animals (dogs) present in the shelter plus the new ones who just arrived?

subanswer.text: Initially, there are 9070002 dogs already accounted for; then 8 additional dogs arrive making it 9070002 + 8 = 9070010. Then double these numbers make 9070010 x 2 = 18140020. Adding together all accounts makes 18140020 + 9070010 = 27210030 dogs. The answer is 27210030.

ost_step.1: Subtracting 3 from this number because three dogs leave means 27210030 – 3 = 27210027.

1.subquestion: Before going out shopping, what is the number of animals (dogs) present in the shelter plus the new ones who just arrived?

0.user_question: James needs to get more toys for his doggie shelter. Each dog needs one toy. James currently has 9070002 toys on hand for 9070002 dogs, but there are 8 more dogs in the shelter now. After buying the toys, he went back to see that there are twice as many more dogs than when he left so he had to buy some more toys. When James came back yet again, 3 dogs were gone so he no longer needed those toys. How many toys in total does James need?

1.subquestion: Before going out shopping, what is the number of animals (dogs) present in the shelter plus the new ones who just arrived?

subanswer.text: Initially, there are 9070002 dogs already accounted for; then 8 additional dogs arrive making it 9070002 + 8 = 9070010. Then double these numbers make 9070010 x 2 = 18140020. Adding together all accounts makes 18140020 + 9070010 = 27210030 dogs. The answer is 27210030.

direct_answer.text: Let's break down this problem into steps. First we find out the initial count before any changes which was mentioned in hint 1 itself i.e.,  9070002 + 8 = 9070010. Next, since their amount doubles according to 'twice as many', therefore becomes : 9070010 * 2= 18140020. And finally adding both counts altogether leads us up to , or simply summing them up like this ; 18140020+9070010= 27210030 . Henceforth considering every animal requires exactly one toy initially means our target here would remain same regardless if others go away or come aboard because only totals matter not individual transitions throughout time.. Thus following through onto subsequent stages yields .. Total Toys Required ~~(Number Of Dogs). That being said lets plug & play ! We know NumberOfDogshavebeenshuffledarounda bit tillnowbutitsstilltheirinitialcountof9070010soiftheyeachneedoneitmeanstotaltoys
